Total_Links:
Strong Q4 FY25 Results (Announced May 20, 2025): Max Healthcare reported a 21% YoY rise in Profit After Tax (PAT) at ₹376 crore, driven by revenue growth.

FY25 Dividend Recommendation: The board recommended a final dividend of ₹1.5 per equity share for FY25.

Focus on Super-Specialty Care: Max Healthcare agreed to sell smaller hospitals in Bulandshahr and Anoopshahr to focus on super-specialty care in larger cities,according to Digital Health News.

Expansion in Gurugram: Antara Senior Care (a Max India subsidiary) expanded its senior living residences and healthcare services in Gurugram,according to Business Standard.

Bed Capacity Expansion Plans (Announced May 22, 2025): Max Healthcare announced plans to increase bed capacity by 30% in FY26, aiming for 6,500 beds by next year and 9,000 by 2028,according to scanx.trade.

Brownfield Expansion at Max Vaishali: The company completed the acquisition of land adjoining Max Super Specialty Hospital, Vaishali for brownfield expansion.

New Hospital Commissioning: A 160-bed tower was commissioned at Max Mohali during the quarter.

Occupancy and ARPOB: Q1 FY25 revenue growth was driven by higher Average Revenue Per Occupied Bed (ARPOB) and Occupied Bed Days (OBDs).

ESOP Allotment: Equity shares were allotted under the Employee Stock Option Scheme 2020 on May 11, 2025.

Analyst/Investor Call Scheduled: An earnings call for investors and analysts was scheduled for May 13, 2025.

Volume Surge: Max Healthcare shares saw a volume surge on August 19, 2025, closing at ₹1,227.30.

Consistent Profit Growth: The company has delivered a 64% CAGR profit growth over the last 5 years.
